Class cUniverse

java.lang.Object
Data.cUniverse
public class cUniverse extends Object
Represents a universe containing galaxies in the StarViewer application. This class manages a collection of galaxies and provides methods for adding, removing, and manipulating galaxies within the universe. It also includes functionality for generating random universes with specified parameters.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    cUniverse()
    Constructs a new universe with an empty list of galaxies.

    Constructs a new universe with an empty list of galaxies and a specified logger.

  • Constructor Details

    • cUniverse

      public cUniverse()
      Constructs a new universe with an empty list of galaxies. Uses the standby logger as the default logger.

    • cUniverse

      public cUniverse(cLoggingBase logger)
      Constructs a new universe with an empty list of galaxies and a specified logger.
      Parameters:
      logger - the logger to use for this universe

  • Method Details

    • ClearGalaxies

      public void ClearGalaxies()
      Clears all galaxies from the universe. Also clears all stars from each galaxy before removing them.

    • AddGalaxy

      public void AddGalaxy(cGalaxy galaxy) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Appends a galaxy to the end of the universe's galaxy list. If the galaxy is already in the universe, a warning is logged but no exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      galaxy - the galaxy to add to the universe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the galaxy is null

    • AddGalaxy

      public void AddGalaxy(cGalaxy galaxy, int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, IllegalArgumentException
      Inserts a galaxy at a specific index in the universe's galaxy list. If the galaxy is already in the universe, a warning is logged but no exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      galaxy - the galaxy to add to the universe
      index - the index at which to insert the galaxy
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds
      IllegalArgumentException - if the galaxy is null

    • RemoveGalaxy

      public void RemoveGalaxy(cGalaxy galaxy) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Removes a galaxy from the universe by reference. If the galaxy is not in the universe, a warning is logged but no exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      galaxy - the galaxy to remove from the universe
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the galaxy is null

    • RemoveGalaxy

      public void RemoveGalaxy(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Removes a galaxy from the universe by index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the galaxy to remove
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds

    • GetGalaxy

      public cGalaxy GetGalaxy(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException
      Gets a reference to a galaxy at the specified index.
      Parameters:
      index - the index of the galaxy to retrieve
      Returns:
      the galaxy at the specified index
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of bounds

    • GetGalaxyCount

      public int GetGalaxyCount()
      Gets the number of galaxies in the universe.
      Returns:
      the count of galaxies in this universe

    • ToString

      public String ToString(boolean recursive)
      Returns a string representation of the universe with optional recursive details.
      Parameters:
      recursive - if true, includes detailed information about all contained galaxies
      Returns:
      a string representation showing the galaxy count and optionally detailed galaxy information

    • ToString

      public String ToString()
      Returns a string representation of the universe with full recursive details.
      Returns:
      a detailed string representation of the universe and all its contents

    • RandomUniverse

      public void RandomUniverse(long seed, int minGalaxies, int maxGalaxies, int minStars, int maxStars, int minPlanets, int maxPlanets, int minMoons, int maxMoons) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a random universe with the specified parameters and seed. Clears any existing galaxies before generating new content.
      Parameters:
      seed - the seed for random generation (0 for random seed)
      minGalaxies - minimum number of galaxies to generate (must be >= 1)
      maxGalaxies - maximum number of galaxies to generate (must be > minGalaxies)
      minStars - minimum number of stars per galaxy (must be >= 1)
      maxStars - maximum number of stars per galaxy (must be > minStars)
      minPlanets - minimum number of planets per star (must be >= 1)
      maxPlanets - maximum number of planets per star (must be > minPlanets)
      minMoons - minimum number of moons per planet (must be >= 0)
      maxMoons - maximum number of moons per planet (must be > minMoons)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameters are invalid

    • RandomUniverse

      public void RandomUniverse(int minGalaxies, int maxGalaxies, int minStars, int maxStars, int minPlanets, int maxPlanets, int minMoons, int maxMoons) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Generates a random universe with the specified parameters using a random seed. This is a convenience method that calls the seeded version with seed = 0.
      Parameters:
      minGalaxies - minimum number of galaxies to generate (must be >= 1)
      maxGalaxies - maximum number of galaxies to generate (must be > minGalaxies)
      minStars - minimum number of stars per galaxy (must be >= 1)
      maxStars - maximum number of stars per galaxy (must be > minStars)
      minPlanets - minimum number of planets per star (must be >= 1)
      maxPlanets - maximum number of planets per star (must be > minPlanets)
      minMoons - minimum number of moons per planet (must be >= 0)
      maxMoons - maximum number of moons per planet (must be > minMoons)
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if any parameters are invalid

    • TestUniverse

      public void TestUniverse()
      Creates a default test universe with predefined parameters. Generates 2-3 galaxies, each with 9-16 star systems, 1-12 planets per system, and 0-6 moons per planet. Uses a deterministic seed based on the string "default".
